channel.title: Caching on Mohamed Kamal

item.title: Caching: Topologies and Patterns
item.description: What is a Cache? Link to heading A cache is a secondary data store that’s faster to read from than the data’s primary store. The purpose of a cache is to improve application performance by: Reducing network calls to the primary data store: Instead of repeatedly querying the database, the cache handles data retrieval, offloading processing from the database. This reduces database connection consumption, often a limiting factor, and allows the database to perform faster.
